author: Special Correspondent
text:
About 14,864 people who became Indian citizens with the swapping of enclaves along the India-Bangladesh border last year will be eligible to exercise their franchise in the coming West Bengal Assembly polls.

Senior officials of the Election Commission said here on Thursday that the process of applying for their inclusion in the voters’ list started on March 5. On March 12, they could file their objections, Deputy Chief Election Officer Dibyendu Sarkar said.

After the names are included in the final voters’ list, they will figure in the list for the six Assembly constituencies in Cooch Behar district. The assembly segment where the first-time voters will be included are Mekhliganj, Dinhata, Toofanganj, Natabari, Sitalkuchi and Sitai

Elections to these constituencies will be held in the sixth and final phase on May 5. In fact, the election schedule was prepared keeping these new citizens in mind.

Under the Land Boundary Agreement between the two countries, 51 Bangladeshi enclaves in India and about 111 Indian enclaves in Bangladesh were exchanged on July 31, 2015.
title: New citizens in enclaves to vote in Bengal polls
